Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the video shows Muslim men auctioning off women on the streets of England, when in reality, it was a demonstration against ISIS.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or reliable sources to back up the assertion that Muslim men were auctioning off women.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video depicts a real incident of Muslim men auctioning off women, without considering alternative explanations or verifying the accuracy of the footage.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that the video shows a demonstration against ISIS, rather than an actual human auction.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the United Kingdom has strict laws against treating women unequally and selling them in public spaces, regardless of religion or nationality.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the claim.
